intro: Hieracium vicarium, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers and is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stem is usually hairy as well. Hieracium vicarium is often considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid spread and competitive growth.
